# Linq Docs

## How-to articles

- [How to: LINQ and file directories](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/how-to-query-files-and-directories.md): Use Language Integrated Query (LINQ) for file system operations that don't to change the contents of the files or folders.
- [How to: LINQ and strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/how-to-query-strings.md): You can query a string as a sequence of characters in LINQ. This article contains several examples you can use or modify to suit your needs.
- [How to: LINQ and collections](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/how-to-query-collections.md): This series of examples shows you Language Integrated Query (LINQ) techniques to use with collections and arrays.
- [How to extend LINQ with new methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/how-to-extend-linq.md): Learn techniques to extend the standard LINQ methods. Query based on runtime state, modify query objects, and extend LINQ capabilities.
- [How to build dynamic queries at run time](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/how-to-build-dynamic-queries.md): Learn to query dynamically depending on run-time state, by varying either LINQ method calls or the expression trees passed into those methods.

## Language-Integrated Query (LINQ)

- [Overview of LINQ](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/index.md): Introduces Language Integrated Query (LINQ) in C#.

## Children

- [Get Started](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/get-started/llms.txt)
- [Standard Query Operators](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/linq/standard-query-operators/llms.txt)
